SEARCH
Package risk.server.persistence

Klasse CountryInitiator

java.lang.Object
risk.server.persistence.CountryInitiator
public class CountryInitiator extends Object
Initializes and manages country and continent data for the Risk game.

This class is responsible for loading country and neighbor relationships from a file, initializing country objects with their respective neighbors, and organizing countries into continents. It provides methods to initialize countries and continents based on external data files, allowing for dynamic game setups. The class also includes utility methods for retrieving country objects by name.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • CountryInitiator

      public CountryInitiator(String filePath)
      Constructs a new CountryInitiator with the specified file path.

      This constructor initializes the countriesAndNeighbors map and begins the process of loading country and neighbor relationships from the specified file. The file should contain country names followed by their respective neighbors, separated by commas. This data is essential for setting up the game map with accurate territorial adjacencies.

      Parameter:
      filePath - the path to the file containing country and neighbor data. This should include the full path and the file name.

  • Methodendetails

    • initializeCountries

      public List<Country> initializeCountries()
      Initializes countries with their respective abbreviations and neighbors.

      This method processes a pre-loaded map of countries and their neighbors to create Country objects. Each country is initialized with its name and abbreviation, and then its neighbors are added. The abbreviation is assumed to be the first element in the list of neighbors for each country, which is then removed from the list to leave only the actual neighbors.

      After all countries are created and their neighbors set, the method returns a list of all the initialized Country objects. This list is useful for further operations that require a complete set of countries with their relationships established.

      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Country objects, each initialized with a name, abbreviation, and neighbors.

    • initializeContinents

      public List<Continent> initializeContinents(String filePath, List<Country> countries)
      Initializes continents with their respective bonus units and assigns countries to them.

      This method reads from a specified file to create Continent objects, each with a name and bonus units. It then assigns countries to these continents based on the file's contents. The file format should list each continent followed by its bonus units and the countries it contains, separated by commas.

      The method utilizes the getCountryByName method to match country names from the file with Country objects provided in the countries list parameter. This ensures that the continents are accurately populated with the correct countries.

      If the file cannot be read or if an error occurs during processing, an error message is printed to the console.

      Parameter:
      filePath - the path to the file containing continent names, their bonus units, and the countries they contain. The path should include the full path and file name.
      countries - a list of all Country objects to be assigned to continents. This should be the list of countries initialized by the initializeCountries method.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Continent objects, each initialized with a name, bonus units, and a list of countries.

    • getCountryByName

      public Country getCountryByName(String countryName, List<Country> countries)
      Retrieves a Country object by its name from a provided list of countries.

      This method iterates through a list of Country objects, comparing each country's name with the specified countryName. If a match is found, the corresponding Country object is returned. If no match is found, the method returns null, indicating that no country with the specified name exists in the list.

      Parameter:
      countryName - the name of the country to be retrieved.
      countries - a list of Country objects to search through.
      Gibt zurück:
      the Country object with the specified name, or null if no such country exists in the list.
